title: Senior Open Championship
text:
The Senior Open Championship, or simply The Senior Open (and originally known as the Senior British Open) is a professional golf tournament for players aged 50 and over. It is run by <a href="The%20R%26amp%3BA">The R&A</a>, the same body that organises <a href="The%20Open%20Championship">The Open Championship</a>. Prize money won in the event is official money on both <a href="PGA%20Tour%20Champions">PGA Tour Champions</a> (formerly the Senior PGA Tour and Champions Tour) and the <a href="European%20Senior%20Tour">European Senior Tour</a>. The purse, which is fixed in <a href="United%20States%20dollar">United States dollar</a>s, was $2 million in 2011, with a winner's share of $315,600. For sponsorship reasons, it is currently known as The Senior Open Championship presented by <a href="Rolex">Rolex</a>.
The tournament was first held in 1987 and became part of the European Seniors Tour schedule in 1992. It is younger than the <a href="PGA%20Seniors%20Championship">PGA Seniors Championship</a>, which started in 1957, as well as the <a href="U.S.%20Senior%20Open">U.S. Senior Open</a> and the <a href="Senior%20PGA%20Championship">Senior PGA Championship</a>. In late 2002 it was designated as the fifth <a href="Senior%20major%20golf%20championships">major championship</a> on the Champions Tour schedule. Winners before 2003 were not retroactively designated as Champions Tour major winners until late 2018. Winners gain entry into the following season's Open Championship. The event is usually held the week following The Open Championship, although in 1991 it was held the week before the Open and in 1998 it was held in August, three weeks after the Open.
The 2018 Senior Open was held at <a href="Old%20Course%20at%20St%20Andrews">St Andrews</a> for the first time, a decision which was heavily influenced by five-time Open champion <a href="Tom%20Watson%20%28golfer%29">Tom Watson</a>. In 2020, the championship was cancelled due to the <a href="COVID-19%20pandemic">COVID-19 pandemic</a>.
The field.
The standard field size is 144 players and an 18-hole qualifying round is held at the championship course on the Monday before the tournament, with a minimum of 24 places available. If fewer than 120 exempt players enter, the field is filled to 144 with more high finishers from qualifying. If more than 120 exempt players enter, the top 24 finishers earn entry even if it causes the field to expand beyond 144.
